Ngobrol Bareng Risa Santoso, Rektor Termuda di Indonesia
07 Nov 2019, 15:36 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Risa Santoso, Rektor termuda Indonesia (Screenshoot Via Instagram santosorisa)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pada 2 November 2019 kemarin, Institut Teknologi & Bisnis ASIA Malang melantik Risa Santoso sebagai rektor. Kabar ini pun sontak jadi pembicaraan netizen karena Risa masih berusia 27 tahun. Putri dari Tanadi Santoso ini didapuk jadi rektor termuda di Indonesia.Institut Teknologi & Bisnis ASIA, Malang merupakan merger STIE dan STMIK ASIA di Malang. Institut ini berada di bawah naungan Yayasan Wahana Edukasi Cendekia Malang. Mengutip laman Business Wisdom Institute, kampus yang berbasis digital ini juga digawangi oleh ayah Risa, Tanadi Santoso. Tanadi merupakan pengusaha yang salah satu usahanya bergerak dalam bidang pendidikan dan tercatat menjadi trainer di Business Wisdom Institute. Risa Santoso lahir di Surabaya pada 27 Oktober 1992 ini pernah menjadi mahasiswa dari universitas bergengsi di luar negeri. Kuliah S1-nya ditamatkan di University of California, Berkeley di bidang Ekonomi dari tahun 2012-2014.Setelahnya dia kuliah S2 di Harvard University Graduate School of Education pada 2014-2015. Di tengah kesibukannya menjalankan tugas dan menjalani sederet pertanyaan pewarta, CNNIndonesia.com berkesempatan berbincang dengan Risa melalui sambungan telepon pada Rabu (6/11) malam.



CNN (C): Selamat ya telah dipercaya mengemban tugas dan tanggung jawab sebagai rektor, dan menjadi rektor termuda di Indonesia. Bagaimana nih awal-awal masa tugas?Risa Santoso (RS) : Lumayan padat, enggak nyangka juga jadi viral. Tertantang untuk membuktikan bahwa bisa mengerjakan tugas dengan baik.Waktu habis digunakan untuk rapat, relokasi ruangan, SDM, barang, banyak diskusi, konsolidasi dua perguruan tinggi, ya pelan-pelan.C: Cerita dong perjalanan pendidikan dan karier hingga akhirnya jadi rektor.RS: Saya ambil S1 jurusan Ekonomi di University of California, Berkeley. Di situ ambil minor pendidikan karena tertarik dan bisa kan ambil double major. Lalu S2 di Harvard University Graduate School of Education, ambilnya Learning and Teaching.Kembali ke Indonesia, saya bekerja di KSP (Kantor Staf Presiden) di bidang strategis ekonomi, kan memang studinya di awal bidang ekonomi. Di KSP saya banyak melakukan monitoring, bantu kementerian. Di SK (Surat Keterangan) memang enggak ada akhir [kontrak kerja]. Lalu memutuskan kembali ke Malang karena ingin dekat sama keluarga.Setelah di Malang, saya bekerja di Lembaga Penjamin Mutu Internal ITB ASIA Malang selama setahun, lalu sempat jadi direktur pengembangan bisnis selama setahun lebih. Baru setelah itu dicalonkan sebagai rektor.C: Awal berkarier kan bidang ekonomi, lalu kenapa tergerak untuk ke pendidikan?RS: Dari dulu S2 kan pendidikan. Saya berpikir ingin [berkarier] ke pendidikan dan mendapat kesempatan buat coba.Kalau sebelumnya di bidang ekonomi karena sektor yang banyak diperlukan [SDM] di ekonomi. Kapan lagi bisa bantu di pemerintahan. Kerja di public sector kan enggak aneh. Saya ingat waktu di awal Presiden Jokowi menjabat, Pak Luhut [Binsar Panjaitan] sempat bilang yang di luar negeri bantu bangsa, gitu. Ya sudah memutuskan untuk kembali.C: Bagaimana proses Risa terpilih menjadi rektor?RS: Jadi IT ASIA Malang ini ada tiga calon. Ini kan dua perguruan tinggi jadi satu [Sekolah Tinggi Ilmu Ekonomi Asia dan Sekolah Tinggi Manajemen Informatika dan Komputer], dulu adanya ketua kemudian wakil ketua. Begitu jadi satu, menjadi institut jadi jabatannya ada rektor, wakil rektor, dekan dan lain-lain. Jadi ini jabatan rektor pertama.Saya menjadi rektor waktu itu dipilih, bersedia atau tidak. Saya bilang, tanggung jawab rektor itu besar, tapi jadi tantangan [untuk membuktikan bahwa] milenial bisa.C: Apa yang mendorong seorang Risa Santoso untuk sanggup mengemban tanggung jawab besar ini?RS: Saya melihat semangat mahasiswa. Menurut saya mungkin saat sebelum jadi rektor saya membuat program kerjasama dengan negara lain sehingga mahasiswa bisa ke sana dan didukung penuh oleh kampus.Program berupa internship di Filipina, Malaysia. Impactnya besar, mahasiswa jadi pengen membuat kampus jadi lebih maju. Saya merasakan ini jadi dorongan tersendiri. Saya ngobrol tentang program baru dan mendapat support dari mahasiswa.


Foto: Screenshoot Via Instagram santosorisa

C: Selama masa pencalonan, terbayang enggak sih pekerjaan rektor itu seperti apa?RS: Bayangan itu ada, cuma yang enggak kebayang itu jadi viral (Risa tertawa). Setelah dilantik biasa, oh ya sudah kami diskusi dengan dosen, ngobrol sama mahasiswa, minta masukan. Yang mengagetkan itu seberapa suportif dosen dan mahasiswa, dan dari situ saya merasa telah mengambil keputusan tepat.Jadi pemimpin, di usia terbilang muda, padahal jajaran struktural usianya sudah jauh di atas. Bagaimana bakal bisa bekerjasama apalagi memimpin mereka?Banyak yang bertanya seperti itu (sambil tertawa). Tapi menurut saya, asal tujuan satu, jelas, tahu harus ke mana, apa yang mau dicapai, saya rasa bisa. Ada input saya terima, dosen diberi input, oke. Di luar pekerjaan tetap ngajeni (menghargai) senior. Kerja ya profesional.C: Apa saja yang dikorbankan demi menjalankan tugas sebagai rektor?RS: Sekarang karena masih awal-awal, masih konsolidasi, meeting, waktu luang, bersantai jadi berkurang. Biasanya kalau ada waktu luang buat baca majalah, nonton TV, Netflix, olahraga, nongkrong ketemu temen.C: Apa pesan Risa untuk generasi milenial yang juga ingin maju?RS:Jangan takut untuk diberikan tanggung jawab. Biasanya kan milenial itu banyak mikir. Ada tanggung jawab lebih, ambil enggak ya? Mikir-mikir terus. Jangan takut ambil kesempatan, bareng-bareng kita step up, kita kerja. Milenial bisa kok ngasih dampak gede.Yang pasti kerja maksimal. Jangan takut menyuarakan ide. Apa sih yang terburuk dari menyuarakan ide, paling hanya ditolak.C: Seperti apa rencana ke depan setelah menjabat jadi rektor termuda Indonesia di ASIA Malang?RS: Ke depannya itu, PR terbesar untuk belajar sama universitas lain, memastikan bisa bantu kampus untuk jadi kampus yang diakui di Indonesia dan di luar Indonesia, kemudian bisa dipercaya oleh industri, mahasiswa kualitasnya baik. Mahasiswa harus tangguh, pantang menyerah dan berintegritas. Kami ingin belajar dari industri kebutuhan industri sekarang seperti apa.Sempat ngobrol sama mahasiswa, mereka ingin terobosan yang support mereka. Mereka ingin dapat sesuatu yang buka wawasan selain belajar di kelas, lalu buka kesempatan. Waktu itu kami ada workshop dari film Lampor, ada Dion Wiyoko dan pemain film lainnya ke sini menunjukkan bagaimana pembuatan film. Program seperti ini yang saya rasa bisa membuka wawasan mahasiswa, jadi enggak cuma di kelas. (els/chs)
text:
Chatting with Risa Santoso, the Youngest Rector in Indonesia
Nov 7 2019, 15:36 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Risa Santoso, the youngest Indonesian Chancellor (Screenshot Via Instagram Santosorisa)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - On 2 November 2019 yesterday, the ASIA Malang Institute of Technology & Business inaugurated Risa Santoso as rector. This news immediately became a netizens talk because Risa was still 27 years old. The daughter of Tanadi Santoso is lined up to be the youngest rector in Indonesia. The ASIA Institute of Technology & Business, Malang is the merger of STIE and STMIK ASIA in Malang. The Institute is under the auspices of the Wahana Edukasi Scholar Foundation in Malang. Citing the Business Wisdom Institute page, this digital-based campus is also fronted by Risa's father, Tanadi Santoso. Tanadi is an entrepreneur whose business is engaged in education and is listed as a trainer at the Business Wisdom Institute. Risa Santoso was born in Surabaya on October 27, 1992 and was once a student of a prestigious university abroad. His undergraduate degree was completed at the University of California, Berkeley in Economics from 2012-2014. Afterwards he studied S2 at Harvard University Graduate School of Education in 2014-2015. In the midst of his busy work and undergoing a series of reporters' questions, CNNIndonesia.com had the opportunity to talk to Risa via telephone on Wednesday (6/11) night.



CNN (C): Congratulations, yes, you have been entrusted with the duties and responsibilities as chancellor, and become the youngest chancellor in Indonesia. How was the beginning of the assignment? Risa Santoso (RS): It was quite dense, I didn't think it would turn viral either. Challenged to prove that they can do their jobs well. Time is used up for meetings, relocation of rooms, human resources, goods, lots of discussion, consolidation of two universities, slowly. : I took a Bachelor's degree in Economics at the University of California, Berkeley. There, take an education minor because you are interested and you can take the double major. Then I graduated from Harvard University Graduate School of Education, took Learning and Teaching. Returning to Indonesia, I worked at the KSP (Presidential Staff Office) in the area of economic strategic, right? Indeed his studies were at the beginning of the economic field. In KSP I do a lot of monitoring, helping the ministry. In SK (Certificate) there is indeed no end to the [employment contract]. Then I decided to go back to Malang because I wanted to be close to my family. After in Malang, I worked at the Institute of Internal Quality Assurance of ITB ASIA Malang for a year, then I was the director of business development for over a year. Only after that was nominated as chancellor.C: Beginning a career in the field of economics, then why was moved to go to education? RS: From the first S2 was education. I think I want [a career] in education and get a chance to try. If previously in the economic field because of the much needed sector [HR] in the economy. When else can you help in government. Working in the public sector isn't weird. I remember at the time when President Jokowi was in office, Pak Luhut [Binsar Panjaitan] had said that those who were abroad were helping the nation, that is. Yes, I have decided to return. C: What is the process of Risa being elected as Chancellor? RS: So, IT ASIA Malang, there are three candidates. These are the two tertiary institutions (the Asian College of Economics and the College of Information and Computer Management), first there was the chairman and then the vice chairman. As soon as they become one, they become an institute, so their positions are chancellors, vice chancellors, deans and others. So this is the position of first rector. I was the chancellor at that time chosen, willing or not. I said, the chancellor's responsibility was huge, but it was a challenge [to prove that millennials] could.C: What drives a Risa Santoso to be able to take on this great responsibility? RS: I see the enthusiasm of students. I think maybe before I became the Chancellor I made a collaboration program with other countries so that students could go there and be fully supported by the campus. The program was in the form of an internship in the Philippines, Malaysia. The impact is big, students want to make campus more advanced. I feel this to be its own impetus. I chat about new programs and get support from students.


Photo: Screenshot Via Instagram Santosorisa

C: During the nomination, what was the chancellor's job like? RS: The image was there, only the one who did not imagine it went viral (Risa laughs). After being inaugurated, oh yes, we have had discussions with lecturers, talked with students, asked for input. What surprised me was how supportive the lecturers and students were, and from that I felt I had made the right decision. So the leader, at a relatively young age, even though the structural ranks were already far above. How can you work together let alone lead them? Many people ask questions like that (laughing). But in my opinion, as long as there is one goal, obviously, knowing where to go, what you want to achieve, I think you can. I have received input, the lecturer was given input, okay. Outside of work, I still want to (respect) seniors. Professional job. Usually when there is free time for reading magazines, watching TV, Netflix, sports, hanging out meeting friends. Usually millennials think a lot. There are more responsibilities, take it or not? Thinking about it all the time. Do not be afraid to take the opportunity, together we step up, we work. Millennial can really give a big impact. That is sure to work optimally. Don't be afraid to voice ideas. What's the worst from voicing ideas, most just being rejected. C: What's the plan going forward after serving as the youngest Indonesian chancellor at ASIA Malang? RS: In the future, the biggest PR to study with other universities, ensures that it can help the campus to become a campus which is recognized in Indonesia and outside Indonesia, can then be trusted by industry, students of good quality. Students must be tough, never give up and have integrity. We want to learn from the industry what industry needs are like now. Having a chat with students, they want a breakthrough that supports them. They want to be able to open something other than learning in class, then open up opportunities. At that time we had a workshop from the film Lampor, there was Dion Wiyoko and other film players here showing how to make films. Programs like this that I feel can open students' insights, so not only in the classroom. (els / chs)
